conclusion: Analyze the relationship between volume V and temperature T to find temperature at state C.
Graph shows relationship between volume V and temperature T with points O, A, B, C. Point A is at (T0, V0), pA = p0, TA = T0. Line AB is parallel to V axis, BC extends to origin O.
Identify key points and relationships: O is origin, A is at standard conditions, AB parallel to V axis, BC suggests proportional relationship between V and T.
Determine temperature at state C using proportional relationship: VA/VC = T0/TC. Since VA = VC, TC = T0.
Conclusion: Temperature at state C is T0.
